title: Business news - live: Pound falls sharply after DUP says it cannot support Boris Johnson's Brexit deal
text:
The pound fell this morning after the Democratic Unionist Party said it could not support Boris Johnson's Brexit deal as it currently stands.

Sterling continued its erratic course of recent weeks, dropping sharply before recovering to trade a quarter of a per cent down against the dollar.

Elsewhere, WHSmith agreed a $400m deal to buy US travel retailer Marshall and RBS boosted its Brexit contingency fund to £8.2bn.
